etymology.description: Two bent lines indicating original meaning 'to divide' -> borrowed for sound to mean 'eight'
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicting the concept of division, 八 was later borrowed to represent 'eight' due to its similar pronunciation to the numeral. Its initial meaning is now represented by other characters like 分 and 別.

examples.chinese: 我有八支笔(我有八支筆)。
桌子上有八个苹果(桌子上有八個蘋果)。
examples.pinyin: Zhuōzi shàng yǒu bā gè píngguǒ.
examples.english: There are eight apples on the table.

examples.chinese: 我在八点(我在八點)，起床开始一天的生活(起床開始一天的生活)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zài bā diǎn, qǐchuáng kāishǐ yītiān de shēnghuó.
examples.english: I wake up at eight o'clock to start my day.
